channel.title: How to run a 317 on a Windows 7 computer (Tut)
channel.description:
Ok i heard alot of people try to run 317 Client's on a windows 7 computer and when they walk around it crash's this should help alot it works 100% for me :D
[b]1[/b]. Ok First you need to download this - *
[b]2[/b].Open that up and click Windows 7 Coverter
[b]3[/b].Then You will see a line that says ( Batch File: ) Click the ( ... ) on that line then a brows will pop up and go to your client folder and click your .bat that you use to run your client.
[b]4[/b].Then push compile.
[b]5[/b].Now your done! go back to your client folder and if you have a windows 7 computer you can play 317's now and it wont crash the client.
If you have any trouble message me on here i should respond to you.
There is [b]NOT[/b] anti leech on this.
[b][u]This should work on any 317 you try it with[/u][/b] :)

item.title: How to run a 317 on a Windows 7 computer (Tut)
item.dc:creator: @auronx223 auronx223
item.description:
@auronx223 wrote:

used program and didn’t work the exe that got converted the run bat just opened and closed then nothing happened I’m not sure what every time i walk it crashes >.< if your wondering what in the bat its this:

@echo off
cd Client Files
start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

tried changing javaw to C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javaw.exe says it cant find >.< i don’t get why it crashes every time i walk or some any ideas? also all the 508’s+ servers work fine first time or when i change the directory to the java version i have but all 317’s just don’t work D:

Read full topic

  1. Windows 7

  2. Vista

  3. Linux

item.title: How to run a 317 on a Windows 7 computer (Tut)
item.dc:creator: @buut15 buut15
item.description:
@buut15 wrote:

[quote=“owna lune, post:12, topic:328886”]when i click edit it says

@echo off
start http://joker-status.ucoz.com

java -xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui

what do i change?[/quote]

Change the, “java” to… “C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\java.exe”

Example: “C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\java.exe” -xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui

I have Window’s 7. I have to do this on most servers.

Read full topic

item.title: How to run a 317 on a Windows 7 computer (Tut)
item.dc:creator: @Ventrozip Ventrozip
item.description:
@Ventrozip wrote:

There is an easier way to run a 317 on a windows 7 computer… without downloading some damn “converter”…

Change your environment variables, especially if your running on a 64 bit machine and if you are on 32 bit Windows 7 there should not be any problems. If your do not want to set your environment variables you can even just do this…

Edit the “run”
Lets focus on a code that may look something like this

-Xmx300m -cp . Class51 30 0 highmem members 32

If you were on 64 bit and ran a 317 client like this it would immediately shutdown on you. Were missing our 64 bit path.
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe”
Now we can not just paste this over the code we have, some people try this and it does not work or they try to copy+paste the code of the client they configured to work for 64 bit in another client. But not all clients have Xmx300m. Not all clients are the same (most are, but the original ones aren’t).

In conclusion our full code would be this (THIS IS JUST AN EXAMPLE READ ABOVE, THIS MAY NOT WORK FOR YOUR CLIENT IF YOUR RUNNING ON A 64 BIT OS!!!)
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx300m -cp . Class51 30 0 highmem members 32

Read full topic
item.source: How to run a 317 on a Windows 7 computer (Tut)
